data.message: And Facebook is bragging about this...ridiculous.

replies.message: Not ridiculous and yes it is worth bragging about.  You might as well have been one of the people that owned slaves and refused to give them up even after the emancipation proclamation.  Let it go, we deserve our fair rights just like anyone else.  You want to keep them from us because you think that's your right and that you can.

You do realize that facebook is one of the MANY companies that stands for equality right?  Why is it ridiculous?  They have every right to stand up for what they believe in just as much as anyone else.  Equality will happen, it's just a matter of time and I can't wait for the day where everyone can be just as happy and equal as my husband and I.

Chase, why does it need to be publicized. This if anything makes straights not want to accept it. I'm tired of this stuff being publicized like you deserve a cookie for supporting, no, that's not how it goes. Be gay, it doesn't affect me, but constantly having the media shove it down people's throats does.
And.....bragging about data-mining for those listed as LGBT!
